[LEXICON]: "The monitoring device recorded the metrics" (out-of-context technical phrase)

[STRUCTURE]: Sudden insertion of technical devices ("monitoring device," "mobile hotspot," "smartwatch") disrupts narrative flow
Unexplained transitions between Spencer's philosophy and contemporary tech elements
[LOGIC]: Abrupt shifts between philosophical discourse and modern technology references create confusion

[SYNTAX]: Complex sentence structures with multiple subordinate clauses that make reading difficult
Unusual phrasing patterns like "the discussion of which, in the Nonconformist of 1842, constituted the first step from the life of an engineer to that other kind of life"
Archaic constructions like "if there be law it must at bottom be one law"
[PUNCTUATION]: Non-standard punctuation placement in sentences like "There is here, it may be said, no special reference to the organic and the superorganic"

[LOGIC]: Sudden shifts between topics (social/political developments → philosophy of life/mind → evolution as universal principle → Spencer's formula in First Principles)
Disconnected segments discussing different aspects of Spencer's work without clear transitions
Jump from philosophical concepts to specific historical texts (Nonconformist letters, Preface to Howard Collins's Epitome) without clear connections
[STRUCTURE]: Lacks clear organization or progression of ideas that would help readers follow the author's argument
[CLARITY]: Uses complex philosophical terminology without sufficient explanation for general readers
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt transitions between paragraphs discussing different aspects of Spencer's philosophy
